name: chaesar
text:
I cannot wait until the day comes when I can look back on this strip and say, "Oh yeah, I think I do remember when there was so much nonsense on t-shirts all over the goddamn place. I sure am glad that's over."

I'm pretty sure it started with SPAM t-shirts back in '96 or so. Anybody got my back here?

name: boredom_man
text: I think it pretty much started with rock'n'roll.

name: pogo
text: Nope, started way before rock'n'roll.  I'd say the first printing on T-shirts was for colleges, just the name of the institution.  Then somewhere in the early 1960s, silk screen printing came to Ts, and with considerable difficulty, you could screen print your choice of words or basic images.  The ink was sweaty, though.  Better techniques followed, and you could go to large T-shirt printing production houses (there was one in Cincinnatti) and buy their seconds for cheap, and sport all sorts of nonsense on your chest, like the mess crew of an aircraft carrier, or some brand of booze no one ever heard of.  Being able to custom print small batches of Ts is probably from the late 1970s.

text: haha, look at the old guy!

A blogged t-shit would probably get about as much 'outside time' as the rest of Beef's t-shirt collection.

The difference between Beef and other bloggers being: Beef rarely leaves the house in clothes, bloggers rarely leave the house at all.

name: heccibiggs
text:
Dang, blarghamagarky. Seeing this lame on your comment made me think "I've hardly ever seen her be lamed anywhere, how many lames does she have, I wonder?" So, I went to look at your profile and discovered that you have made 271 comments, but received 367 chubbies. That averages out to 1.3542435424354243542435424354244 chubbies per comment.

Wow...

name: i_love_kate
text: And you have on average roughly .02 lames per post. Which is still unwarrantedly high.

name: heccibiggs
text: Me? Or blarghamagarky?

name: heccibiggs
text: Oh okay I just worked out my lame average which is 0.05..something, so clearly that was directed at blarghamagarky.

name: i_love_kate
text: No, I'm just weak at maths. Or maybe you suddenly got a lot of lames between my calculation and yours. Who can say?

name: heccibiggs
text:
I don't know, I haven't had a Maths lesson for like three years now so I could just be totally shit.

But cheers for the compliment!

name: blarghamagarky
text:
Hahaha. My lames to chubbies ratio always sticks around 1:10

The majority of them came from that one episode of a thread on Abraxas with Tekende and when I posted a video of Rodney Dangerfield and no one watched it and I got angry

name: fineoakstructure
text:
Hey man I said I watched it.

Also I've been meaning to ask this about your semi-new avatar: so is that you again or is that ripped from some Sarah Brightman album cover?

wtf is sarah brightman

PS it's your mother

name: fineoakstructure
text:
"Heh! Probably not, but maybe?"

I love how Ray, whenever confused by a question that he completely doesn't understand, begins his answer (in a falsely unassuming but obviously embarrased way) with "Heh!" I think I do that, and this particular line has become a favorite of mine.

text: This needs to be rated so much higher, if only because it sports three of the finest Onstadisms of all time. Help join my campaign to get this strip into the 4.7 Club.

name: nice-on-water
text: Thank you for validating my obsession with fonts.

name: alzuna
text: No problem, I too suffer from this obsession...It is a trying burden.

name: heccibiggs
text: One time I was at my friend's house, and he had to go and do something for a little while, so I was sitting in his room all bored and alone, so my first thought was, okay, internet, but his wireless connection was down (of course), and then I thought, right, um, games? But it was a Mac and had no games like solitaire or whatever, so then I thought, all right, I'll doodle in a Paint-type application, but there was nothing like THAT either, so finally I found his Fonts folder and just perused that for a while. It was okay.

name: nice-on-water
text: I was sooooo overjoyed when I got my new laptop last summer because, even though Vista is kind of crass, some of the fonts are ri dic ulous. I got Blue Highway, man! The fucking highway sign font! How dope is that? I was TOO overjoyed by this.
